file_content.text: Just get yourself to Balmorra, and wait for our call.
And don't think this is all about serving the Republic, either.
There's a fortune to be made in this war. An enterprising individual could end up with a criminal empire to rival Rogun.
Details, man, details.
Oh?
I'll give them as I get them.
Criminal empire.... You make it sound so sexy.
[Flirt] Ooh. Say that again.
Did I say we could trust Darmas? I meant not trust him. Ever.
I can't think of anything sexier than a woman with a pile of credits and her own private army.
Ew.
If I can help the Republic, that's enough for me.
I'm ready to be a hero.
No reason you can't do both.
Rival Rogun? I'm going to annihilate him!
That's all?
You really aren't an easy woman to live with, are you?
You don't know the half of it.
Ha! Start small, my friend. You try to take Rogun in one bite, you just might choke.
There's a power vacuum in the underworld with the big names gone--Nok Drayen, the Hatchet, Ivory... but I have a feeling you'll be up there one day.
Just keep that in mind when you're on Balmorra. The opportunities are there, you just have to take them.
I think we made it through before the noose tightened.
I'm glad you did the same. Of all my fantasies of you, shackled as an Imperial captive was never my favorite.
And I'm glad you did the same, Captain.
I'll stay and make sure Port Nowhere doesn't land in any more of Rogun's or the Voidwolf's little parties.
You can think of her as a "safe harbor."
So, how's this privateer thing work, anyway?
Where to now?
Well, you heard the Senator. Balmorra's the target.
When you get closer, one of us will give you the specs. With things changing so fast, there's no point in an early briefing.
Appreciate it.
I couldn't think of anyone better to suggest to the Senator.
Just be careful.
Aw, darling. Just the sound of that warms my heart.
Don't worry about me. I always land on my feet.
Get to your ship! Now!
Captain! Good thing you're prompt, or I'd be a dead man. The second we got off the link, Rogun's men turned up.
I hear you stopped them single-handedly. I wouldn't want your life, Captain, but it's rather a thrill to watch.
We don't often see this sort of thing in the Galactic Senate. You were impressive, Captain--almost worth getting kidnapped for.
This is Senator Bevera Dodonna. I work with her now. Rah-rah, hail the Republic--etcetera, etcetera.
What's a Senator want with someone like you?
You've gone legit?
I've been investigating how the Republic can make better use of... independent-minded soldiers of freedom.
Which is why Rogun tried to shut us down. He's an Imperial lackey. His whole criminal empire answers directly to Imperial Command.
Is that the reason Rogun came after you?
So what?
Actually, probably, yes....
I hope the opportunity you're offering wasn't just the chance to kill Rogun's thugs.
Let's talk business.
You never waste time.
Rogun the Butcher is an Imperial lackey--a puppet on a string for Imperial High Command.
There's an Imperial fleet waiting out there. Rogun's men were going to deliver us to the Imperials!
This isn't that guy, is it? The, uh, slaver with the stupid name?
Risha mentioned an Imp fleet.
The Voidwolf--and I wouldn't say that to his face. My father didn't fear much, but he never messed with the Voidwolf.
The Voidwolf, right? Is that who Rogun's fetching for?
The Voidwolf.
What guy? Are you talking about the Voidwolf? What have you heard?
He's got contacts in every major gang; Rogun's one of his biggest assets.
Once they're both dead, we won't have to keep track.
I don't need the scorecard.
The old Butcher's not going to be around much longer.
Not for long.
Given your performance here today, I believe you.
Time to put "the Butcher" down.
Yeah, Rogun's gotta go.
And if you accept my offer, you won't have to take him on alone.
Still not sure what this has to do with me.
Get to the point.
The Republic is looking for men and women of action, patriots without the restrictions of a trooper's uniform.
How would you like a commission from the Galactic Senate, authorizing you as a privateer naval captain, tasked to target Imperial forces at will?
Go where I want, kill bad guys and be the hero? I'd be a fool to say no.
Sounds exciting.
Then by the power vested in me by the Galactic Senate, I hereby swear you in as a true servant of the Republic, privateer.
Now don't you wish you'd showered and shaved before we came?
Don't look all formal and serious. You know it's just a fancy name for a pirate.
She doesn't know you well, does she? The captain's never been anyone's servant.
You will serve them well.
I never wanted to get that cozy with the Republic. But I never met a Senator like you.
[Flirt] I might....
You are unbelievable! What's the catch on this? We're not going anywhere on your say-so.
There are no other Senators like me.
What's the catch?
Tell me the rest of it.
We can't support you openly... but I think those are the kinds of missions you prefer.
I see what you get out of that arrangement, but....
What's in it for me?
It's nothing worse than what you take on daily, for profit a lot smaller than we can offer and a cause far less worthy.
It's a straightforward deal. We give you targets, cargo, the job we need done and all the support we can covertly provide.
In return, we look the other way about any laws you break, or private gains you make along the way.
You got a target in mind, or do I just fly around the galaxy shooting anything ugly?
Where to first?
The Republic can count on me.
[Flirt] I won't let you down.
Oh, aren't we noble and selfless all of a sudden?
Don't worry, I know a born liar when I see one. So, I'll check up on you. Often.
I can't just take your word, can I? I'll have to check up on you. Often.
Sounds like a good deal.
Works for me.
A fancy badge won't get you out of paying for my services.
Let's talk price.
Don't worry, the Republic will see you well-compensated.
Our top target right now is Balmorra. One of the most likely hotspots for open war to be declared.
Is there anyone in the galaxy who still thinks we aren't at war?
As opposed to closed war?
The longer we lie, the more people live.
I know we're waiting until they're on-planet for the full briefing, but maybe in a word...?
Balmorra used to supply half the Republic's military resources. Now it's occupied by the Imperials and all that technology is going to the--
Never heard of Balmorra. Is it part of the Republic?
Tell me about Balmorra.
Not exactly. Before the Empire occupied it, it was our single greatest supplier of weapons, ships and military droids.
Skip the politics. Just tell me what I can sell.
Anything valuable there.
Balmorra is the richest producer of droids and military technology in the known galaxy. And now it's occupied by the Empire.
We need someone to go behind enemy lines and divert a payload of dangerous prototype weapons. Put them in our hands, not the Empire's.
I'll head there right now.
Sounds fun.
All right. When you get there, talk to--
Anything else I should know?
Give me all the details.
I can transmit some background--
You really want to put me in the way of that kind of temptation?
Maybe I'll take them myself.
Unless you've got a fleet of warships to mount them on, these prototypes won't do you much good.
Empire!
Empire!
Imperial fleet de-cloaked, port side. No, ah! Starboard side. They're all around us!
It's the Voidwolf! Aaaaah!
Get your ship. Go back to Coruscant. You too. Get out of here. I'll try to jump this whole tub before they board us.
Go!
Yes, um, as far as we know, Grand Admiral Kirill--the "Voidwolf"--does have, well, ties to Rogun....
Then the Voidwolf dies, too.
